amendment.description: To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to helping students, particularly students who are low-income or minorities or who have special needs, that suffered from school closures pushed by teacher labor organizations that ignored the science and ensuring that all schools should be open for in-person learning 5 days a week for the 2021-2022 school year.

vote.text: Amendment SA 3073 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 50. Record Vote Number: 324.

action.text: Amendment SA 3073 proposed by Senator Scott SC. (consideration: CR S6213-6214; text: CR S6213) To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to helping students, particularly students who are low-income or minorities or who have special needs, that suffered from school closures pushed by teacher labor organizations that ignored the science and ensuring that all schools should be open for in-person learning 5 days a week for the 2021-2022 school year.
